caption.title: Phylogenetically informative discrete characters of vestibular morphology that represent potential synapomorphies of either hominoids or hominids.

tr.td: Insertion of the lateral SC slender portion on the vestibule
0 = posterior (lateral SC intersecting the posterior SC plane); 1 = anterior (not intersecting)
Trajectory of the lateral SC ampullar portion
Angle between the planes identified by the anterior and posterior SCs
Inclination and size of the posterior SC relative to the size of the anterior and lateral SCs
0 = forming a right angle and equal or larger in size, 1 = posteriorly tilted and smaller
Extension of vestibular recesses relative to that of the SCs

fn.p: a Character state 0 represents the primitive condition reconstructed for the last common ancestor of crown catarrhines.
b Some platyrrhines display a superior eccentricity of the anterior SC that might be apomorphic.
